page.title: 01Area South - Robin Hoods Bay
page.content: A beautiful area bordering on Robin Hoods Bay. Hilly farmland predominantly grassland with some arable crops, but flanked by moorland to east & south. Two small becks enter the sea here and their valleys are wooded with deciduous trees. The higher moorland ands abruptly at Stoup Brow escarpment in the south east corner which dominates the area together with Rowenscar and its cliffs. Robin Hoods Bay village is nearby and the whole area has great scientific value; and this together with the bays rocky shore & beaches make it one of the most popular areas in the North Yorkshire Moors National Park for tourists.
